Paris copic if you don't know who we are we're a socially conscious data visualization firm and if you don't know
what data visualization is I'm not sure why you're here you just want to come see free talks i guess but data
visualization sort of means different things to different people and to Paris copic data visualization means taking
things that are intangible so things like numbers are statistics things in
databases and and spreadsheets and making them not only visual invisible
but creating an experience around those numbers as well so we worked on projects
anywhere from telling stories about the habitat of polar bears and the threats
to the polar bears because of climate change or you know the change in how the
warming ocean temperatures affect salmon populations we worked on projects about
the historical context of income inequality a wide range of things and
for the past year I've been talking a lot about our process because it was really fascinating to me and didn't
really occur to me until about two years ago that we actually go through a creative process to do data
visualization so we take these raw numbers and these things that are really intangible which is typically done by a
data scientist or a statistician or somebody a computer programmer somebody
who knows numbers and understands databases and how to work those things and how to clean them up and program
around them and then they take them and make them into something beautiful and so it didn't really dawn on me that that
was actually a creative process because I don't think it dawns on most people that that's a creative process so for
the past year I've been really talking about how we do that and it's changing as I learn how we do that we just sort
of do it and we don't really think about how it's done so I've been sort of
dissecting that and going along and telling people more and more about how we do that and then I started really
fixating on the the thing I think at the core of it and really what happens at
the very genesis of a project which is we really have to get at the core of
what that data is so the emotional side of it we have to get back to the data

in the fine print as the data source but i mean the actual thing that's creating
the data and so you could think of it as though you know when that data comes to

where this data has come from right so there's the what I like to call the
things doing their things which is the data creation so whatever that is it's salmon swimming in an ocean it's you
know polar bears dying whatever it's me it's me standing here my height is 55
that data comes for me I created it the data doesn't exist without me so that's

been analyzed or you do that as part of the visualization but I think a lot of
people start at chapter four without really going back and looking at chapter one and that's really what this talk is

using it and this is this is me and my little icon there that's our office
Paris copic and the purlin in Portland so you could see it real time and if I

one day not too long after we started using this I was I was having this

right about there I was on i-5 I got on i-5 south and about 10 seconds after I
